desc: Students examine, through intensive reading and discussion, contemporary approaches to classical issues in metaphysics, which include the mind-body problem, personal identity and immortality, space, time and causality, realism, anti-realism and truth. Specific issues discussed vary from year to year. Prerequisite: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235 or 236, or permission of the department chair. Offered 2001-02 and every two years.
name: Studies: Metaphysics
title: Studies in Metaphysics
